wikipedia_page.main: Eunice Frost (1914–1998), was a British publisher. She started in 1936, working for Penguin Books, as secretary to co-founder Allen Lane, but soon was promoted to editor, and eventually a director of the company.

response: The company's expansion saw the hiring of Eunice Frost—first as a secretary, then as editor, and ultimately as a director, who was to have a pivotal influence in shaping the company. In 1945 she was entrusted with the reconstruction of Penguin Inc after the departure of its first managing director, Ian Ballantine.Lewis, Penguin Special, 2005, Ch. 11, para. 12.
